p: Acourtia thurberi, “Matarique” or “Matarique morado”, belongs to the family Asteraceae. This perennial herb is a medicinal plant with lavender or purple flowers and is found in the northern Sierra Madre Occidental and the mountains of southern Arizona and New Mexico [ 93]. Normally, it is consumed in a tea containing its roots, for the treatment of kidney disease, diabetes and back pain associated with the kidneys [ 31]. A. thurberi has antihyperglycemic [ 94] and antinociceptive effects [ 95]. In the latter study, the pharmacological effects were attributed to the presence of perezone, α-pipitzol, β-pipitzol and 8-β-D-glucopyranosyloxy-4-methoxy-5-methyl-coumarin ( Figure 1), which were isolated from the roots of A. thurberi.
